intro: Phyllorkis bracteolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Phyllorkis bracteolata is a perennial herb that is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
